DOC.brief_summary: This intervention program combine biofeedback PFME telephone support group intervention treat persistent urinary incontinence ( UI ) . The study 's primary aim improve continence , quality life , mood enhance adherence PFME self-management incontinence symptom . The secondary aim examine physiological effect cost effectiveness propose intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Improving Urinary Continence Quality Life Prostate Cancer Patients
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , control longitudinal study . Patients early-stage prostate cancer UI six month randomly assign one three study arm : ( 1 ) biofeedback PFME plus support group ( BF+SUPPORT ) ; ( 2 ) biofeedback PFME plus telephone ( BF+PHONE ) ; ( 3 ) usual care ( UC ) . The BF+SUPPORT BF+PHONE participant learn PFME computerize biofeedback . Thereafter , BF+SUPPORT participant attend six group meeting BF+PHONE participant six phone contact every week three month . The UC participant receive biofeedback PFME telephone/group intervention continue receive usual medical care . All subject assess blind baseline , 3 month ( post intervention ) 6 month ( follow-up ) . In addition , 49 moderately severely incontinent patient recruit three study group undergo urodynamic test baseline 3 month evaluation physiological change . Data cost intervention participant ' medical care collect cost-effectiveness analysis .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Have diagnose early stage ( IIII ) prostate cancer . 2 . Have complete cancer treatment six month prior . 3 . Presence incontinence symptoms 1 . Receiving hormonal treatment . 2 . Urinary tract infection urinary retention . 3 . Cognitive impairment . 4 . Having implant
